description: VirtualNode is the Schema for the VirtualNodes API. Provides an AWS App Mesh virtual node resource.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: VirtualNodeSpec defines the desired state of VirtualNode

deletionPolicy.description:
DeletionPolicy specifies what will happen to the underlying external
when this managed resource is deleted - either "Delete" or "Orphan" the
external resource.
This field is planned to be deprecated in favor of the ManagementPolicies
field in a future release. Currently, both could be set independently and
non-default values would be honored if the feature flag is enabled.
See the design doc for more information: https://github.com/crossplane/crossplane/blob/499895a25d1a1a0ba1604944ef98ac7a1a71f197/design/design-doc-observe-only-resources.md?plain=1#L223

meshName.description: Name of the service mesh in which to create the virtual node. Must be between 1 and 255 characters in length.

meshNameRef.description: Reference to a Mesh in appmesh to populate meshName.

resolution.description:
Resolution specifies whether resolution of this reference is required.
The default is 'Required', which means the reconcile will fail if the
reference cannot be resolved. 'Optional' means this reference will be
a no-op if it cannot be resolved.

resolve.description:
Resolve specifies when this reference should be resolved. The default
is 'IfNotPresent', which will attempt to resolve the reference only when
the corresponding field is not present. Use 'Always' to resolve the
reference on every reconcile.

meshNameSelector.description: Selector for a Mesh in appmesh to populate meshName.

matchControllerRef.description:
MatchControllerRef ensures an object with the same controller reference
as the selecting object is selected.

matchLabels.description: MatchLabels ensures an object with matching labels is selected.

resolution.description:
Resolution specifies whether resolution of this reference is required.
The default is 'Required', which means the reconcile will fail if the
reference cannot be resolved. 'Optional' means this reference will be
a no-op if it cannot be resolved.

resolve.description:
Resolve specifies when this reference should be resolved. The default
is 'IfNotPresent', which will attempt to resolve the reference only when
the corresponding field is not present. Use 'Always' to resolve the
reference on every reconcile.

meshOwner.description: AWS account ID of the service mesh's owner. Defaults to the account ID the AWS provider is currently connected to.

name.description: Name to use for the virtual node. Must be between 1 and 255 characters in length.

region.description:
Region where this resource will be managed. Defaults to the Region set in the provider configuration.
Region is the region you'd like your resource to be created in.

backend.description: Backends to which the virtual node is expected to send outbound traffic.

virtualService.description: Virtual service to use as a backend for a virtual node.

certificate.description: Virtual node's client's Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate.

privateKey.description: Private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the mesh endpoint that the proxy is running on.

secretName.description: Name of the secret secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

enforce.description: Whether the policy is enforced. Default is true.

ports.description: One or more ports that the policy is enforced for.

subjectAlternativeNames.description: SANs for a TLS validation context.

match.description: Criteria for determining a SAN's match.

exact.description: Values sent must match the specified values exactly.

acm.description: TLS validation context trust for an AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) certificate.

secretName.description: Name of the secret secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

virtualServiceName.description: Name of the virtual service that is acting as a virtual node backend. Must be between 1 and 255 characters in length.

certificate.description: Virtual node's client's Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate.

privateKey.description: Private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the mesh endpoint that the proxy is running on.

secretName.description: Name of the secret secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

enforce.description: Whether the policy is enforced. Default is true.

ports.description: One or more ports that the policy is enforced for.

subjectAlternativeNames.description: SANs for a TLS validation context.

match.description: Criteria for determining a SAN's match.

exact.description: Values sent must match the specified values exactly.

acm.description: TLS validation context trust for an AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) certificate.

secretName.description: Name of the secret secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

listener.description: Listeners from which the virtual node is expected to receive inbound traffic.

connectionPool.description: Connection pool information for the listener.

grpc.description: Connection pool information for gRPC listeners.

maxRequests.description: Maximum number of inflight requests Envoy can concurrently support across hosts in upstream cluster. Minimum value of 1.

http.description: Connection pool information for HTTP listeners.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of outbound TCP connections Envoy can establish concurrently with all hosts in upstream cluster. Minimum value of 1.

maxPendingRequests.description: Number of overflowing requests after max_connections Envoy will queue to upstream cluster. Minimum value of 1.

http2.description: Connection pool information for HTTP2 listeners.

maxRequests.description: Maximum number of inflight requests Envoy can concurrently support across hosts in upstream cluster. Minimum value of 1.

tcp.description: Connection pool information for TCP listeners.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of outbound TCP connections Envoy can establish concurrently with all hosts in upstream cluster. Minimum value of 1.

healthCheck.description: Health check information for the listener.

healthyThreshold.description: Number of consecutive successful health checks that must occur before declaring listener healthy.

intervalMillis.description: Time period in milliseconds between each health check execution.

path.description: File path to write access logs to. You can use /dev/stdout to send access logs to standard out. Must be between 1 and 255 characters in length.

port.description: Port used for the port mapping.

protocol.description: Protocol used for the port mapping. Valid values are http, http2, tcp and grpc.

timeoutMillis.description: Amount of time to wait when receiving a response from the health check, in milliseconds.

unhealthyThreshold.description: Number of consecutive failed health checks that must occur before declaring a virtual node unhealthy.

outlierDetection.description: Outlier detection information for the listener.

baseEjectionDuration.description: Base amount of time for which a host is ejected.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

interval.description: Time interval between ejection sweep analysis.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

maxEjectionPercent.description:
Maximum percentage of hosts in load balancing pool for upstream service that can be ejected. Will eject at least one host regardless of the value.
Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 100.

maxServerErrors.description: Number of consecutive 5xx errors required for ejection. Minimum value of 1.

portMapping.description: Port mapping information for the listener.

port.description: Port used for the port mapping.

protocol.description: Protocol used for the port mapping. Valid values are http, http2, tcp and grpc.

idle.description: Idle timeout. An idle timeout bounds the amount of time that a connection may be idle.

dns.description: DNS service name for the virtual node.

hostname.description: DNS host name for your virtual node.

ipPreference.description: The preferred IP version that this virtual node uses. Valid values: IPv6_PREFERRED, IPv4_PREFERRED, IPv4_ONLY, IPv6_ONLY.

responseType.description: The DNS response type for the virtual node. Valid values: LOADBALANCER, ENDPOINTS.

initProvider.description:
THIS IS A BETA FIELD. It will be honored
unless the Management Policies feature flag is disabled.
InitProvider holds the same fields as ForProvider, with the exception
of Identifier and other resource reference fields. The fields that are
in InitProvider are merged into ForProvider when the resource is created.
The same fields are also added to the terraform ignore_changes hook, to
avoid updating them after creation. This is useful for fields that are
required on creation, but we do not desire to update them after creation,
for example because of an external controller is managing them, like an
autoscaler.

managementPolicies.description:
THIS IS A BETA FIELD. It is on by default but can be opted out
through a Crossplane feature flag.
ManagementPolicies specify the array of actions Crossplane is allowed to
take on the managed and external resources.
This field is planned to replace the DeletionPolicy field in a future
release. Currently, both could be set independently and non-default
values would be honored if the feature flag is enabled. If both are
custom, the DeletionPolicy field will be ignored.
See the design doc for more information: https://github.com/crossplane/crossplane/blob/499895a25d1a1a0ba1604944ef98ac7a1a71f197/design/design-doc-observe-only-resources.md?plain=1#L223
and this one: https://github.com/crossplane/crossplane/blob/444267e84783136daa93568b364a5f01228cacbe/design/one-pager-ignore-changes.md

items.description:
A ManagementAction represents an action that the Crossplane controllers
can take on an external resource.

providerConfigRef.description:
ProviderConfigReference specifies how the provider that will be used to
create, observe, update, and delete this managed resource should be
configured.

resolution.description:
Resolution specifies whether resolution of this reference is required.
The default is 'Required', which means the reconcile will fail if the
reference cannot be resolved. 'Optional' means this reference will be
a no-op if it cannot be resolved.

resolve.description:
Resolve specifies when this reference should be resolved. The default
is 'IfNotPresent', which will attempt to resolve the reference only when
the corresponding field is not present. Use 'Always' to resolve the
reference on every reconcile.

writeConnectionSecretToRef.description:
WriteConnectionSecretToReference specifies the namespace and name of a
Secret to which any connection details for this managed resource should
be written. Connection details frequently include the endpoint, username,
and password required to connect to the managed resource.

x-kubernetes-validations.rule: !('*' in self.managementPolicies || 'Create' in self.managementPolicies || 'Update' in self.managementPolicies) || has(self.forProvider.name) || (has(self.initProvider) && has(self.initProvider.name))

!('*' in self.managementPolicies || 'Create' in self.managementPolicies || 'Update' in self.managementPolicies) || has(self.forProvider.spec) || (has(self.initProvider) && has(self.initProvider.spec))

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of outbound TCP connections Envoy can establish concurrently with all hosts in upstream cluster. Minimum value of 1.

healthCheck.description: Health check information for the listener.

healthyThreshold.description: Number of consecutive successful health checks that must occur before declaring listener healthy.

intervalMillis.description: Time period in milliseconds between each health check execution.

path.description: File path to write access logs to. You can use /dev/stdout to send access logs to standard out. Must be between 1 and 255 characters in length.

port.description: Port used for the port mapping.

protocol.description: Protocol used for the port mapping. Valid values are http, http2, tcp and grpc.

timeoutMillis.description: Amount of time to wait when receiving a response from the health check, in milliseconds.

unhealthyThreshold.description: Number of consecutive failed health checks that must occur before declaring a virtual node unhealthy.

outlierDetection.description: Outlier detection information for the listener.

baseEjectionDuration.description: Base amount of time for which a host is ejected.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

interval.description: Time interval between ejection sweep analysis.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

maxEjectionPercent.description:
Maximum percentage of hosts in load balancing pool for upstream service that can be ejected. Will eject at least one host regardless of the value.
Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 100.

maxServerErrors.description: Number of consecutive 5xx errors required for ejection. Minimum value of 1.

portMapping.description: Port mapping information for the listener.

port.description: Port used for the port mapping.

protocol.description: Protocol used for the port mapping. Valid values are http, http2, tcp and grpc.

grpc.description: Connection pool information for gRPC listeners.

idle.description: Idle timeout. An idle timeout bounds the amount of time that a connection may be idle.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

http.description: Connection pool information for HTTP listeners.

idle.description: Idle timeout. An idle timeout bounds the amount of time that a connection may be idle.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

http2.description: Connection pool information for HTTP2 listeners.

idle.description: Idle timeout. An idle timeout bounds the amount of time that a connection may be idle.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

tcp.description: Connection pool information for TCP listeners.

idle.description: Idle timeout. An idle timeout bounds the amount of time that a connection may be idle.

unit.description: Unit of time. Valid values: ms, s.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

certificate.description: Virtual node's client's Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate.

acm.description: TLS validation context trust for an AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) certificate.

privateKey.description: Private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the mesh endpoint that the proxy is running on.

secretName.description: Name of the secret secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

mode.description: Listener's TLS mode. Valid values: DISABLED, PERMISSIVE, STRICT.

subjectAlternativeNames.description: SANs for a TLS validation context.

match.description: Criteria for determining a SAN's match.

exact.description: Values sent must match the specified values exactly.

secretName.description: Name of the secret secret requested from the Secret Discovery Service provider representing Transport Layer Security (TLS) materials like a certificate or certificate chain.

logging.description: Inbound and outbound access logging information for the virtual node.

accessLog.description: Access log configuration for a virtual node.

format.description: The specified format for the logs.

key.description: The specified key for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

value.description: The specified value for the JSON. Must be between 1 and 100 characters in length.

text.description: The logging format for text. Must be between 1 and 1000 characters in length.

path.description: File path to write access logs to. You can use /dev/stdout to send access logs to standard out. Must be between 1 and 255 characters in length.

serviceDiscovery.description: Service discovery information for the virtual node.

awsCloudMap.description: Any AWS Cloud Map information for the virtual node.

attributes.description: String map that contains attributes with values that you can use to filter instances by any custom attribute that you specified when you registered the instance. Only instances that match all of the specified key/value pairs will be returned.

namespaceName.description:
Name of the AWS Cloud Map namespace to use.
Use the aws_service_discovery_http_namespace resource to configure a Cloud Map namespace. Must be between 1 and 1024 characters in length.

serviceName.description: attribute of the dns object to hostname.

dns.description: DNS service name for the virtual node.

hostname.description: DNS host name for your virtual node.

ipPreference.description: The preferred IP version that this virtual node uses. Valid values: IPv6_PREFERRED, IPv4_PREFERRED, IPv4_ONLY, IPv6_ONLY.

responseType.description: The DNS response type for the virtual node. Valid values: LOADBALANCER, ENDPOINTS.

tagsAll.description: Map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider default_tags configuration block.

items.description: A Condition that may apply to a resource.

lastTransitionTime.description:
LastTransitionTime is the last time this condition transitioned from one
status to another.

message.description:
A Message containing details about this condition's last transition from
one status to another, if any.

observedGeneration.description:
ObservedGeneration represents the .metadata.generation that the condition was set based upon.
For instance, if .metadata.generation is currently 12, but the .status.conditions[x].observedGeneration is 9, the condition is out of date
with respect to the current state of the instance.

reason.description: A Reason for this condition's last transition from one status to another.

status.description: Status of this condition; is it currently True, False, or Unknown?

type.description:
Type of this condition. At most one of each condition type may apply to
a resource at any point in time.

observedGeneration.description:
ObservedGeneration is the latest metadata.generation
which resulted in either a ready state, or stalled due to error
it can not recover from without human intervention.
